assigmentName: How to Use the Reading Matrix with Journal Articles

options.label: To find out as much as possible about marketing.
To decide if the articles contain material which is relevant to my assignment.
To learn about Higher Education in the UK.
To find out what each writer has to say about the key drivers.
To understand where the writers agree and disagree.

To develop your academic reading skills, you need to...

📚 Read widely 

and

📚 Read effectively

 

 

🤔 But what does this mean?
data.template:
• Reading widely means reading {{response}} about the topic so that your knowledge comes from {{response}} and includes {{response}}.
  • Reading effectively means developing strategies to {{response}}, read {{response}}, identify the {{response}} and deal with {{response}}.

stems: They are similar to newspaper articles.
They are a reliable academic resource.
They are usually divided into different sections.
You must read all the sections carefully to understand it.
University students usually read journal articles for fun.
University students usually read journal articles as research for their assignments.
data.stimulus:
In this part of the lesson, we will focus on...

 

📝 Check your knowledge about this type of text:

ui_style.stem_title: What do you know about journal articles?

value: A brief summary of all the journal article.
The background necessary to understand the paper.
An explanation of how the author(s) did their research.
The main arguments and evidence of the research. It can have several sub-sections.
A summary and synthesis of the arguments.
The list of all the sources used.

possible_responses: An explanation of how the author(s) did their research.
The list of all the sources used.
The main arguments and evidence of the research. It can have several sub-sections.
A summary and synthesis of the arguments.
The background necessary to understand the paper.
A brief summary of all the journal article.

stems: Key drivers: factors which influence international student study choices
International student issues during the course programme
International student feedback after the course programme
data.stimulus:
To finish off today's lesson, we will focus on the first article of your reading list.

 

You can find this article in your Class Notebook.

 

 

💡 In order to answer the questions below, you don't have to read the article - just focus on the section headings.

 

 

The main body has three sections.

► Which section or sections are relevant for your Market Report?

options.label: The first main body section is relevant because it's about international students and university study.
The first main body section is relevant because it's about the students' decision-making process BEFORE they choose their university.
The second and third main body sections are not relevant because they not about international students.
The second main body section is not relevant because is about student problems DURING the course.
The second main body section is relevant because it's about how international students are assessed.
The third main body section is not relevant because it's based on opinions not facts.
The third main body section is not relevant because it's about student feedback AFTER the course is finished.
The third main body section is relevant because it's about international students' careers.

data.stimulus: Why? Choose THREE correct answers.
